  • |Export
  • |Available export formats
  • Latest release: 0.9.0

Available export formats

Preamble

The following formats are available: CSV, XML, PDF, XLS and XLSX.

Note that depending on the export formats you allow in a table, you may need some additional dependencies.

Text-based export formats: CSV, XML

For the text-based export formats, such as CSV or XML, no additional dependency is required.

You have two options to generate export files:

  • Either you use the default export classes. Indeed Dandelion-Datatables includes some export classes that are configured by default: CsvExport and XmlExport .
  • Or you configure other export classes. See this tutorial to know how to proceed.

Binary-based export formats: XLS, XLSX, PDF

Binary export formats, such as XLS or PDF, require most of the time some additional dependencies.

Note that Dandelion-Datatables also includes some extras that you can use in these cases:

  • datatables-export-itext: used for PDF exports
  • datatables-export-poi: used for XLS exports
  • datatables-export-poi-ooxml: used for XLSX exports (Excel 2007 or later)

Each of those dependencies contains:

  • an export class that will be used by default by Dandelion-Datatables if the corresponding export format is allowed in the table.
  • the corresponding third-party dependency (e.g. the iText library for the datatatables-export-itext extra)

In order to use one of these extras, just add the corresponding dependency to your classpath. See bellow:

XLS export

  • Maven
  • Gradle
  • Grails
  • Ivy
  • Grape
  • Buildr
  • SBT
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.dandelion</groupId>
    <artifactId>datatables-export-poi</artifactId>
    <version>0.9.0</version>
</dependency>

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi:0.9.0'

<dependency org="com.github.dandelion" name="datatables-export-poi" rev="0.9.0" />

@Grapes( 
   @Grab(group='com.github.dandelion', module='datatables-export-poi', version='0.9.0') 
)

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi:jar:0.9.0'

libraryDependencies += "com.github.dandelion" % "datatables-export-poi" % "0.9.0"

compile 'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi:0.9.0'

XLSX export

  • Maven
  • Gradle
  • Grails
  • Ivy
  • Grape
  • Buildr
  • SBT
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.dandelion</groupId>
    <artifactId>datatables-export-poi-ooxml</artifactId>
    <version>0.9.0</version>
</dependency>

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi-ooxml:0.9.0'

<dependency org="com.github.dandelion" name="datatables-export-poi-ooxml" rev="0.9.0" />

@Grapes( 
   @Grab(group='com.github.dandelion', module='datatables-export-poi-ooxml', version='0.9.0') 
)

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi-ooxml:jar:0.9.0'

libraryDependencies += "com.github.dandelion" % "datatables-export-poi-ooxml" % "0.9.0"

compile 'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-poi-ooxml:0.9.0'

PDF export

  • Maven
  • Gradle
  • Grails
  • Ivy
  • Grape
  • Buildr
  • SBT
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.dandelion</groupId>
    <artifactId>datatables-export-itext</artifactId>
    <version>0.9.0</version>
</dependency>

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-itext:0.9.0'

<dependency org="com.github.dandelion" name="datatables-export-itext" rev="0.9.0" />

@Grapes( 
   @Grab(group='com.github.dandelion', module='datatables-export-itext', version='0.9.0') 
)

'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-itext:jar:0.9.0'

libraryDependencies += "com.github.dandelion" % "datatables-export-itext" % "0.9.0"

compile 'com.github.dandelion:datatables-export-itext:0.9.0'

Note that those extras are just here to help you or to get inspired for writing your own. You can of course add the dependency manually and write your own export class that uses it.
